lexUnit.name: range.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the distance that is possible (for someone or something to do something)

sentence.text: Once over the Black Sea , the aircraft would hopefully quickly get out of range of most of the land-based missile sites , and the only danger would come from the Soviet Navy .
Which gives us the advantage , and keeps us out of range of their artillery . "
A courting stallion stays out of kicking range while he smells the mare cautiously .
Mum nearly collapsed with the shame of his confession , delivered with a straight face , and by the time she 'd recovered , Jimmy was well out of the range of her punitive umbrella .
Then he strode away -- but only as far as the corner of the hearing room , temporarily out of range of the television cameras .
He had the light behind him and a WPC took shorthand just out of range of Ian 's sight .
The only difference is a distinct advantage : on large waters a punt will enable you to fish swims which are not within casting range of the bank .
Then , instead of working close in , the cleaner should be positioned well back just within the maximum range of the jet and roughly on the centre line of the equipment to be cleaned .
Other animals , such as the Rousettus fruit bats , produce sounds at a higher frequency , although still within our range of hearing .
Let them get within range of our mortars and see how many trucks we can knock out , for a start . "
There are several Cepheids well within binocular range , and some can be followed throughout their variations with the naked eye : Eta Aquilæ , Zeta Geminorum and Beta Doradûs , for example .
Amy was hovering out of camera range , looking decidedly worried .
But their range of binocular vision is only about 30° .
A line stretching beyond the range of his vision , above or below him , becomes a fearsome thing -- at its worst when curving over and behind him .
It took only another few steps for Mait to come within range of the other bomb .
The Helblaster has a strength of 5 at short range and 4 at long range .
With a range of 10,000 miles , the aircraft could have managed its mission although each sortie would have taken nearly thirty hours !
The 988 cc car , aimed primarily at commuters , has a range of 120 miles .
Bear in mind when buying a locator system that a working range of 6-7 feet is adequate .
This gun 's got a range of about three hundred metres and your mother 's a very good shot .
An inquest on Grant Mann has been told that he was shot in the head at close range .
A POLICE officer wept yesterday as he told a jury at the Old Bailey , in London , of the night his colleague was shot dead at point-blank range .
` A ladies " gun , " he said , ` but remarkably effective at close range . "
Despite its range , the adoration of the Vespa is not universal .
The Serbs seemed unlikely to meet another demand to move their remaining heavy guns out of range of Sarajevo by noon ( 1000 GMT ) Friday .
The treacherous mountain road within range of Serb guns is the only land route out of Sarajevo .
In their latest attack on Kabul , Taliban fighters quickly recaptured ground lost in March , again placing their heavy artillery and mortars within striking range of the capital .
Split has n't been hit by fighting though like all Croatian cities it is within range of Serb missiles .
